thread.title: Adele confirms next album will be called 25, apologises to fans for absence
thread.title_full: Adele confirms next album will be called 25, apologises to fans for absence

author: Ebony Bowden
title: Adele confirms next album will be called 25, apologises to fans for absence
text:
It has been nearly five years since Adele released her last album. Photo: Jonathan Short 
Adele album launch date, Glastonbury rumours Most anticipated albums of 2015 Singer Adele has confirmed her new album will be called 25  in a revealing open letter to fans also explaining her four-year absence.
In the note posted to Twitter on Wednesday, the 27-year-old said her new album had been a lesson in learning to love herself and stop wishing her life was different.
Adele at the 2012 Grammy Awards. Photo: Supplied 
Aside from recording the James Bond Skyfall theme in 2013, the British singer hasn't released any new material since her 2011 Grammy Award-winning album  21 .
Advertisement "I feel like I've spent my whole life so far wishing it away," Adele wrote. "Always wishing I was older, wishing I was somewhere else, wishing I could remember and wishing I could forget too."
"Wishing I hadn't cut my hair off, wishing I was 5'7". Wishing I'd waited and wishing I'd hurried up as well.
"My last record was a break-up record and If I had to label this one I would call it a make-up record. I'm making up with myself."
Adele indicated her life had changed dramatically since releasing 21 , giving birth to her first child, son Angelo, in 2012.
" 25 is about getting to know who I've become without realising. And I'm sorry it took so long, but you know, life happened."
Fans of the songstress have been salivating over her new album following the release of a 30-second teaser clip on British television over the weekend.
According to Rolling Stone , the singer's first single from 25  will premiere on BBC Radio 1 on Friday, October 30.
Adele is rumoured to have collaborated artists such as Lady Gaga and OneRepublic frontman Ryan Tedder on the new album.
